about.summary: A set of distributions  which can be used  for modelling the response variables in Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape, Rigby and Stasinopoulos (2005), <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2005.00510.x>. The distributions can be continuous, discrete or mixed  distributions.  Extra distributions can be created, by transforming, any continuous distribution defined on the real line,  to  a distribution defined on ranges 0 to infinity  or  0 to 1,  by using a ''log'' or a ''logit' transformation respectively.

name: r-gamlss.dist

about.summary: A set of distributions  which can be used  for modelling the response variables in Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape, Rigby and Stasinopoulos (2005), <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2005.00510.x>. The distributions can be continuous, discrete or mixed  distributions. raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "6.1-1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-gamlss.dist
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/gamlss.dist_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/gamlss.dist/gamlss.dist_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d2db3a7658799c2ef212aa18cb75a3ecf4f73faf8c13dfdc3c14b21ae0129069

build:
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('gamlss.dist')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('gamlss.dist')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://www.gamlss.org/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: "A set of distributions  which can be used  for modelling the response variables in Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape, Rigby and Stasinopoulos (2005), <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2005.00510.x>. The distributions can be continuous, discrete or mixed  distributions.  Extra distributions can be
    created, by transforming, any continuous distribution defined on the real line,  to  a distribution defined on ranges 0 to infinity  or  0 to 1,  by using a ''log'' or a ''logit' transformation respectively. "
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Description: A set of distributions  which can be used  for modelling the response variables in Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape, Rigby and Stasinopoulos (2005), <doi:10.1111/j.1467-9876.2005.00510.x>. The distributions can be continuous, discrete or mixed  distributions.
